body.p: Oracc OB-Freie Regular (Oracc-OBF) is a minor adaptation of the No-Latin version of Corvin Ziegeler's OB-Freie Regular font (OBF). The sign forms are based on C. Mittermayer, Altbabylonische Zeichenliste der sumerisch-literarischen Texte, listed in OSL as ABZL.
The original font was obtained from https://github.com/crzfub/OB-Freie/blob/main/OBFreie in October 2024.
Oracc OB-Freie Regular is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1 as required by the licensing terms of OB-Freie.
ABZL022 ŠEŠ.KI 𒋀𒆠 is defined in OBF as a ligature of ŠEŠ+NA 𒋀𒈾; Oracc-OBF defines the ligature as ŠEŠ+KI.

OSL calls ABZL084 |ŠIM×X₂|. OBF handles ŠIM×X 󰁞 as a ligature of ŠIM+GA; Oracc-OBF removes the ligature and puts the OBF ŠIM×X.liga 󰁞 in U+F005E. The Šulgi X sign form 󰁕 from ABZL084 is LAK661 = |ŠIM@g×PI| = 󰁕 , 󰁕 U+F0055 so this glyph/codepoint has been added to Oracc-OBF.
ABZL215 merges UMUM (U+12323 𒌣) and DE₂ (U+12324 𒌤). OBF has DE₂ (UMUM@s 𒌤) in U+12323. Oracc-OBF puts DE₂ 𒌤 in U+12324 and puts UMUM (𒌣, the last instance drawn in ABZL215) in U+12323.
OBF has a variant form of ABZL281 = U+1212F 𒄯, 𒄯 in u12132 = |HI×GAD| 𒄲, OBF u12132=𒄯. Oracc-OBF moves 𒄯 to u1212F.ss01 and deletes u12132.
OBF has the same glyph 𒐼 in U+1243C (ABZL472) and U+12409 (ABZL474); Oracc-OBF replaces the glyph in U+12409 with the ABZL474 form 𒐉.

The double-encoded character 𒐂 U+121F9 CUNEIFORM SIGN LIMMU2 is defined in OBF but does not belong because 𒐂 U+12402 CUNEIFORM NUMERIC SIGN 4 ASH is preferred. U+12402 is also in OBF and is the number referenced in Signlist_aBZL_OBF.pdf. The glyph u121F9 is deleted in Oracc-OBF.
The following possible modifications have not yet been made.

OBF defines some characters in SS01 but it is not clear whether these are intended to be a consistent stylistic variation or if they could be equally well represented with SALT. In the draft Oracc guidelines for use of OT features these would probably be SALT variants. A future version of Oracc-OBF could redefine the .ss01 characters as .1, etc.

OBF puts 𒐭 at U+1242D 𒐭 and 𒐮 at U+1242E 𒐮, which is reasonable. The sign forms are in a series of |ŠAR₂×U|, which is given in lexical lists from 1(U)..5(U) and these could also be encoded as separate codepoints. Oracc PUA has U+F003D |ŠAR₂×(U.U)| 󰀽 and U+F003E |ŠAR₂×(U.U.U)| 󰀾. Oracc-OBF could also move/duplicate 𒐭 𒐮 there.

All of the Oracc fonts are downloadable from the Oracc II GitHub repository. in the msc/fonts subdirectory.

In Oracc projects the font is selected with the CSS class ofs-oobf. Because the design size of Oracc-OBF is slightly smaller than Oracc-Noto this page also uses ofs-150 to enlarge the Oracc-OBF characters.
